text.front:
EUROPHYSICS LETTERS
1 October 1997
Europhys. Lett., 40 (1), pp. 7-12 (1997)
Determinism test and noise estimate
for a complex time series
J.-S. Lih 1 , J.-Y. Ko 1 , J.-L. Chern 1 and I.-M. Jiang 2
1 Nonlinear Science Group, Department of Physics
National Cheng Kung University Tainan
-Taiwan 70101, Republic of China
2 Department of Physics, National Sun Yat-Sen University Kaohsiung
Taiwan 80424, Republic of China
( received 15 May 1997; accepted 25 August 1997 )
PACS. 05.45+b -Theory and models of chaotic systems.
Abstract. -
We address the issue of recognizing determinism in a time series. Specifically, we
employ the method of singular-value decomposition (SVD) to derive the eigenvalue spectra of
the trajectory matrices constructed from a number of scalar time series, mainly white noise and
chaotic signals, where a very large embedding dimension is used. The results suggest that the
SVD eigenvalue spectrum can be employed as a measure of determinism and an estimate for
the strength of a noise contained in the time series can be deduced.
c Les Editions de Physique
